creation.ocp.cluster.valid.mac: Value must be valid MAC address format.
creation.ocp.cluster.valid.url: Value must be a valid URL.
creation.ocp.cluster.valid.key: Value must be a valid security key.
creation.ocp.cluster.valid.json: Value must be a valid json.
creation.ocp.cluster.valid.ip: Value must be valid IPv4 or IPv6 format.
creation.ocp.cluster.valid.cidr: Value must be a valid IPv4 or IPv6 CIDR.
creation.ocp.cluster.valid.cidr.membersh: The address is not contained by the subnet defined by the {{0}} {{1}}.
creation.ocp.cluster.valid.user.ip: Value must be in user@xx.xx.xx.xx[.xx] format.
Value must be alphanumeric, including periods.
creation.ocp.cluster.valid.port: Value must be an integer port value
creation.ocp.cluster.valid.repopath: Value for the repository path must consist of alphanumeric characters, '-', '.' or '_', and must start and end with an alphanumeric character
creation.ocp.cluster.valid.imageregistry: Value must have the format HOSTNAME:PORT/PATH
creation.ocp.cloud.select.ocp.image: Select or enter a release image
creation.ocp.cloud.no.ocp.images: No default images. Enter a release image path.
creation.ocp.cloud.no.connections: No defined connections. Select 'Add a connection' to create a connection.
creation.ocp.cluster.add.label: Add another label
creation.ocp.cluster.node.pool.info: The instance type and quantity of master and worker nodes to create for your cluster. Additional worker nodes can be added after the cluster is created.
tooltip.creation.ocp.argocd.cluster: Create cluster with support for ArgoCD
creation.ocp.choose.distribution: Choose an infrastructure type to host your Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform cluster.
creation.ocp.choose.infrastructure: Select an infrastructure provider to host your {{0}} cluster.
creation.ocp.choose.images: Provide credentials to access installation images.
creation.ocp.node.master.pool.title: Master pool
creation.ocp.node.worker.pool.title: Worker pool {{0}}
creation.ocp.node.network.title: Network {{0}}
creation.ocp.node.network.info: Specify at least one network. Multiple are required for IPv6.
creation.ocp.node.master.pool.info: Three master nodes will be created to control this cluster unless single node is enabled, in which case there will only be one master node.
creation.ocp.node.worker.pool.info: One or more worker nodes will be created to run the container workloads in this cluster.
creation.ocp.pool.name: Pool name
creation.ocp.choose.hosts: Select at least 3 bare metal assets that are on the same bridge networks as the hypervisor.
creation.ocp.choose.hosts.sno: Select 1 bare metal asset that is on the same bridge networks as the hypervisor.
creation.ocp.validation.errors.hidden: * This table has validation errors. Some errors only appear in the YAML file.
creation.ocp.validation.errors.hosts: * A bare metal cluster requires at least three (3) masters.
creation.ocp.validation.errors.hosts.sno: * A bare metal single node cluster requires one (1) master.
creation.ocp.host.name: Name
creation.ocp.name: Cluster name
placeholder.creation.ocp.cluster.ost.ext: OPTIONAL: Enter one or more external DNS IP addresses
clusterPool.creation.ocp.name: Cluster pool name
clusterPool.tooltip.creation.ocp.size: The desired number of clusters for the cluster pool.
clusterPool.tooltip.creation.ocp.name: The unique name of your cluster pool. The value must be a string that contains lowercase alphanumeric values, such as dev. Cannot be changed after creation.
clusterPool.tooltip.creation.ocp.namespa: The namespace to create your cluster pool. Multiple cluster pools can be created in the same namespace.
clusterPool.creation.ocp.choose.distribu: Select the type of Kubernetes distribution to use for your cluster pool.
clusterPool.creation.success.title: Cluster pool created
tooltip.text.overview: View operations details across all of your providers.
tooltip.text.search: Find resources across clusters with keywords and filters.
tooltip.text.providerConnection: A provider connection stores the access credentials and configuration information for creating clusters.
tooltip.text.importCluster: Import clusters from different providers to manage them from this console.
tooltip.modal.create-acmbaremetalasset.b: The address to communicate with the hosted BMC controller. IPMI, iDRAC, iRMC, and Redfish protocols are supported. For example: ipmi://, idrac://, irmc://, redfish://
The MAC address of the host's network-connected NIC that is used to provision the host.
tooltip.creation.ocp.name: The unique name of your cluster. The value must be a string that contains lowercase alphanumeric values, such as dev. Cannot be changed after creation.
tooltip.creation.ocp.clusterSet: A ManagedClusterSet is a group of managed clusters. With a ManagedClusterSet, you can manage access to all of the managed clusters in the group together.
tooltip.creation.ocp.addition.labels: Additional key/value pairs that are intended to help you organize your objects. Labels can be used to specify identifying attributes of objects that are meaningful and relevant to you.
tooltip.creation.ocp.baseDomain: The base domain of your provider, which is used to create routes to your OpenShift Container Platform cluster components. It is configured in your cloud provider's DNS as a Start Of Authority record (SOA). Cannot be changed after creation.
tooltip.creation.ocp.choose.distribution: The type of Kubernetes distribution you are using. Cannot be changed after creation.
tooltip.creation.ocp.cloud.connection: The settings that are required for the selected provider. You can select an existing connection, or add a new connection. Cannot be changed after creation.
tooltip.creation.ocp.cluster.network: A block of IP addresses from which pod IP addresses are allocated. The OpenShiftSDN network plug-in supports multiple cluster networks. The address blocks for multiple cluster networks must not overlap. Select address pools large enough to fit your anticipated workload. The default value is 10.128.0.0/14.
tooltip.creation.ocp.choose.aws.infrastr: The provider to host the control plane and compute plane machines. Cannot be changed after creation.
tooltip.creation.ocp.choose.gcp.infrastr: The provider to host the control plane and compute plane machines. Cannot be changed after creation.
tooltip.creation.ocp.choose.azr.infrastr: The provider to host the control plane and compute plane machines. Cannot be changed after creation.
tooltip.creation.ocp.cluster.network.typ: The pod network provider plug-in to deploy. The OVNKubernetes plug-in is available as a Technology Preview on OpenShift Container Platform 4.4 & 4.5. It is generally available on OpenShift Container Platform 4.6. OVNKubernetes is required for IPv6. The default value is OpenShiftSDN.
tooltip.creation.ocp.cluster.vmw.network: The name of the vSphere network to use.
tooltip.creation.ocp.machine.cidr: A block of IP addresses used by the OpenShift Container Platform hosts.The address block must not overlap any other network block. The default value is 10.0.0.0/16.
tooltip.creation.ocp.cluster.network.hos: The subnet prefix length to assign to each individual node. For example, if hostPrefix is set to 23, then each node is assigned a /23 subnet out of the given CIDR, allowing for 510 (2^(32 - 23) - 2) pod IP addresses. The default is 23.
tooltip.creation.ocp.purpose: A label to define the purpose of your cluster. Some examples might be dev, test, or prod.
tooltip.creation.ocp.service.network: A block of IP addresses for services. OpenShiftSDN allows only one serviceNetwork block. The address block must not overlap any other network block. The default value is 172.30.0.0/16.
tooltip.cluster.create.ocp.image: URL to the OpenShift install image set to use. Available images are listed, or you can enter your own path to add an image to the list.
tooltip.cluster.create.ocp.image.vmw: URL to the OpenShift install image set to use. Available images are listed, or you can enter your own path to add an image to the list. Only versions 4.5, and later, are supported for VMware vSphere.
tooltip.cluster.create.ocp.singleNode: To enable a single node OpenShift cluster with one master node and zero worker nodes. Only available in OpenShift 4.8 and higher.
tooltip.creation.ocp.master.zones: The availability zones where your master nodes are located. You can select more than one zone to meet availability or user proximity needs. If you do not select any zones, all available zones are used.
tooltip.creation.ocp.worker.zones: The availability zones where your worker pools are located. You can select more than one zone to meet availability or user proximity needs. If you do not select any zones, all available zones are used.
tooltip.creation.ocp.aws.region: The AWS region where the installation program creates your cluster resources. You can select zones within the region for your master and worker pools.
tooltip.creation.ocp.azr.region: The name of the Azure region where your cluster is hosted. For example, centralus for Azure. You can select zones within the region for your master and worker pools.
tooltip.creation.ocp.gcp.region: The GCP region where you deploy your cluster. You can select zones within the region for your master and worker pools.
tooltip.creation.ocp.aws.instance.type: The EC2 instance type for your compute machines.
tooltip.creation.ocp.aws.root.storage: The EC2 instance root volume size.
tooltip.creation.ocp.azr.root.storage: The Azure disk size for the VM.
tooltip.creation.ocp.vmw.root.storage: The vSphere disk size for the VM.
tooltip.creation.ocp.pool.name: The name for your worker pool.
tooltip.creation.ocp.compute.node.count: The number of nodes in this node pool.
tooltip.creation.ocp.network.cidr: The CIDR for the network to use for provisioning. Example: 172.22.0.0/24
tooltip.creation.ocp.network.interface: The name of the network interface on the control plane nodes that are connected to the provisioning network.
tooltip.creation.ocp.network.bridge: The name of the bridge on the hypervisor that is attached to the provisioning network.
tooltip.creation.ocp.external.bridge: The name of the bridge of the hypervisor that is attached to the external network.
tooltip.creation.ocp.api.vip: The Virtual IP to use for internal API communication. The DNS must be pre-configured with an A/AAAA or CNAME record so the api.<cluster name>.<Base DNS domain> path resolves correctly.
tooltip.creation.ocp.ingress.vip: The Virtual IP to use for ingress traffic. The DNS must be pre-configured with an A/AAAA or CNAME record so the *.apps.<cluster name>.<Base DNS domain> path resolves correctly.
tooltip.creation.ocp.dns.vip: The Virtual IP to use for internal DNS communication.
tooltip.creation.ocp.host.disable.certif: By default, hosts require valid certificates signed by a known certificate authority. Enable this option for environments where certificates are signed by unknown authorities.
tooltip.creation.ocp.cluster.hosts: The bare metal assets which will serve as the hosts of this cluster.
tooltip.creation.ocp.cloud: A label that identifies the cluster infrastructure.
tooltip.creation.ocp.region: A label that identifies where this cluster is located.
tooltip.creation.ocp.namespace: The namespace of your cluster. Must be a string that contains lowercase alphanumeric values. Cannot be changed after creation.
tooltip.creation.ocp.imageMirror: Optional: Disconnected registry path, defined as hostname, port and repository path. It must contain all the installation images, and is used in disconnected installations. Example: repository.com:5000/openshift/ocp-release.
tooltip.creation.ocp.cluster.ost.externa: The name for the external OpenStack network.
tooltip.creation.ocp.cluster.ost.api.flo: The existing floating IP address on the external network for the OpenShift API
tooltip.creation.ocp.cluster.ost.ingress: The existing floating IP address on the external network for the ingress port
tooltip.creation.ocp.cluster.ost.externa: The external DNS IP addresses for name resolution on the private network.
modal.import-acmbaremetalasset.button.to: Imports a CSV (comma-separated values) file. The first line must be a header row that defines the following columns: hostName, hostNamespace, bmcAddress, macAddress, role, username, password.
enter.add.label: Enter key=value
delete.label: Delete label
button.save.access.denied: You are not authorized to save any changes.
changes.maybe.lost: Changes you made might not be saved.
search.label: Find
find.label: Find
overview.error.default: An unexpected error occurred. Try again.
formerror.valid.name: Must consist of lower case alphanumeric characters, '-' or '.', and must start and end with an alphanumeric character
formerror.valid.baseDNSPeriod: The base DNS domain must not begin with a period.
formerror.projectID.format: Must consist of 6 to 30 lowercase alphanumeric characters or '-', and must start with a letter and not end with '-'
creation.invalid.url: Value must be a valid URL format.
creation.missing.timeWindow.days: Select at least one day to create a time window.
creation.missing.timeWindow.timezone: Select a timezone to create a time window.
import.form.invalid.dns.label: The value must be a valid DNS label that consists of up to 63 lowercase alphanumeric characters. The character '-' is also permitted, as long as it does not appear in the first or last position.
validation.missing.any.kind: Resource is missing a kind declaration (ex: kind: {{0}})
validation.missing.keys: The '{{0}}' resource is missing these keys: {{1}}
validation.bad.type: The '{{0}}' key must point to this value type: {{1}}
validation.bad.value: The '{{0}}' key must point to one of these values: {{1}}
template.create.title: Create Ansible template
template.clusterCreate.name: Ansible Automation Template
template.clusterCreate.title: Automation
template.clusterCreate.info: (Optional) Choose an automation job template to automatically run Ansible jobs at different stages of a cluster's life cycle. To use this feature, the Ansible Automation Platform Resource Operator must be installed.
template.create.tooltip: Create a job template to automatically run Ansible jobs at different stages of a cluster's life cycle
template.edit.title: Edit Ansible template
template.edit.tooltip: Edit a job template to alter the order of Ansible jobs that run at different stages of a cluster's life cycle
